intro: Cyclopogon truncatus, commonly known as the truncated cyclopogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Arecaceae family, which includes palms, and is characterized by its slender, unbranched stem. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with yellowish-white flowers, and its leaves are typically long and pinnately divided. It thrives in coastal and saline environments, making it an important species in coastal ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered plant.
